description.narrative: Number of constituent projects within the CPP which meet their impact targets in a costeffective manner

comment.narrative: 80 throughout the life of the CPP

91 average CPP5 CPPP1 CPP5 met its impact targets to 83 CPP1 met its impact targets to 99 and CPP2 is starting its implementation since it began in May 2015 CPPP1 technically he closed in November 2014 and financially closed in November 2015 and done the objectives proposed by the project The CPP2 formally began to be implemented from the inception workshop all actions related to their stage of PPG were fulfilled successfully and satisfactorily PRODOC was approved
CPP3 is in the development phase of the PRODOC Also the preparation stage PRODOC the drafting of logical framework and the letter CEO the work plan and procurement plan of the PPG stage was realized All this demonstrates a good relation costeffective of CPP projects
80 throughout the life of the CPP

91 average CPP5 CPPP1 CPP5 met its impact targets to 83 CPP1 met its impact targets to 99 and CPP2 is starting its implementation since it began in May 2015 CPPP1 technically he closed in November 2014 and financially closed in November 2015 and done the objectives proposed by the project The CPP2 formally began to be implemented from the inception workshop all actions related to their stage of PPG were fulfilled successfully and satisfactorily PRODOC was approved
CPP3 is in the development phase of the PRODOC Also the preparation stage PRODOC the drafting of logical framework and the letter CEO the work plan and procurement plan of the PPG stage was realized All this demonstrates a good relation costeffective of CPP projects

description.narrative: Number of national and international institutions both within and outside the CPP which coordinate with and complement GEFfunded investments in the CPP in their initiatives and plans related to SLM

comment.narrative:
All 25 members of the core target group all 46 key collaborating institutions
and 4 international agencies

42 institutions At this stage we add another 3 national institutions and continue relations with UNEP FAO UNDP We held a second exchange with IADIZA in Mendoza Argentina and began sharing experiences with specialists and producers of ABE Mangrove and JAICA south of Havana projects and strengthening the experiences with basal and PVR projects

All 25 members of the core target group all 46 key collaborating institutions
and 4 international agencies

description.narrative: Proportion of local stakeholders in area covered by CPP who are satisfied with CPP decisions results and products

comment.narrative: 50 in year 3 60 in year 5 80 from year 7 on

Total satisfaction 875
900 with decisions 850 with results and 875 with products
In the latter period as a result of the strengthening of the project management unit with 6 additional members shows that have been more precise decisions in managing the project and the CPP Respect to the results reflect a slight decrease mainly given for the delay in the start of projects 2 and 3 respectively and the prolongation of the project 1 In general was observed an improvement in the perception of the management of CPP

description.narrative: The effectiveness and efficiency of SLM initiatives in Cuba is maximized programmewide
Proportion of the core target group of 25 key institutions nationwide which is participating in the coordinated and integrated use of lands based on sustainable land management principles

comment.narrative:
18 members of the core target group by end of year 7
25 members of the core target group by end of Program

38 institutions are participating in the implementation of the CPP During this last period 8 new institutions over the reported until June 30 2014 were added due to start the project CPP 2 beginning of the preparation stage of the Project Document project CPP 3 and the extension of the actions of SLM across the country
The new entities are UMA Holguín UMA Tunas UMA Stgo De Cuba UMA Ciego de Ávila UMA I Juventud Univ Pedagógica Villa Clara Univ PR IPU Villena Revolución

description.narrative: Proportion of area covered by CPP where agreements for coordination between national provincial and municipal authorities for the use of lands based on sustainable land management principles are developed and in place

comment.narrative: No systems exist specific to SLM
50 of national territory covered by agreements by year 5 70 by year 8 and 80 by year 10
The 542 of national territory In this last period actions on SLM were replicated in 91 municipalities outside the CPP Intervention Areas 45 additional municipalities relative to the previous period

description.narrative: 1.Proportion of the core target group of 25 key institutions nationwide which is participating in the coordinated and integrated use of lands based on sustainable land management principles. 2. Proportion of area covered by country programme where agreements for coordination between national, provincial and municipal authorities for the use of lands based on sustainable land management principles are developed and in place.

comment.narrative: 1. 0 1. No systems exist specific for sustainable land degradation.

1. Sumar 15 nuevas instituciones a las acciones del CPP para acumular 80 instituciones participantes del programa. 2. Cubrir 100% del territorio nacional con acuerdos de coordinación entre las autoridades nacionales, provinciales y municipales para el uso de las técnicas de manejo sostenible de tierras

1. 94 instituciones forman parte y participan en la implementación del Programa de Asociación de País.
2. En el 100% del territorio nacional se desarrollan e implementan acuerdos de coordinación entre las autoridades a nivel nacional, provincial y municipal para la implementación de las prácticas de manejo sostenible de tierras. Esto es posible porque se han firmado acuerdos con instituciones que tienen representatividad en los 3 niveles.

1. 60 institutions are participating in the implementation of the Country Programme Partnership (CPP). 2. The 85% of national territory is covered by the Country Programme Partnership (CPP) where agreements for coordination among national, provincial and municipal authorities for the use of lands based on sustainable land management principles are developed and in place. 70 municipalities outside the country programme intervention areas.

1. More than 60 institutions are participating in the implementation of the Country Programme Partnership (CPP). 2. The 90% of national territory is covered by the Country Programme Partnership (CPP) where agreements for coordination among national, provincial and municipal authorities for the use of lands based on sustainable land management principles are developed and in place. 75 municipalities outside the country programme intervention areas.

1. 70 institutions are participating in the implementation of the Country Programme Partnership (CPP). 2. The 80% of national territory is covered by the Country Programme Partnership (CPP) where agreements for coordination among national, provincial and municipal authorities for the use of lands based on sustainable land management principles are developed and in place. 80 municipalities outside the country programme intervention areas.

1. More than 65 institutions are participating in the implementation of the Country Programme Partnership (CPP). 2. The 95% of national territory is covered by the Country Programme Partnership (CPP) where agreements for coordination among national, provincial and municipal authorities for the use of lands based on sustainable land management principles are developed and in place. 90 municipalities outside the country programme intervention areas.
